trans-unit.source: The result obtained when the value of <

trans-unit.source: The result obtained when the value of literal-1 or identifier-1 is divided by the value of literal-2 or identifier-2 is computed; this result is then moved into each identifier-3, in turn, applying the rules defined by the ROUNDED (see ROUNDED) clause (if any) for that identifier-3 to the move.
trans-unit.target: 计算将 literal-1 或 identifier-1 的值除以 literal-2 或 identifier-2 的值所获得的结果；然后将该结果移到每个 identifier-3 中，依次将针对该 identifier-3 的 ROUNDED （请参阅ROUNDED）子句（如果有）定义的规则应用于移动。

trans-unit.source: The result obtained when the value of literal-2 or identifier-2 is divided by the value of literal-1 or identifier-1 is computed; this result is then moved into each identifier-3, in turn, applying the rules defined by the ROUNDED (see ROUNDED) clause (if any) for that identifier-3 to the move.
trans-unit.target: 计算将 literal-2 或 identifier-2 的值除以 literal-1 或 identifier-1 的值所获得的结果；然后将该结果移到每个 identifier-3 中，依次将针对该 identifier-3 的 ROUNDED （请参阅ROUNDED）子句（如果有）定义的规则应用于移动。

trans-unit.source: The results I saw here were consistent with those that would have been obtained from most of the COBOL implementations I have ever worked with — USAGE COMP has a significant performance advantage over USAGE DISPLAY and USAGE BINARY-LONG (and presumably the other BINARY-xxx usages as well) perform identically, within the measurement tolerances of the test.
trans-unit.target: 我在这里看到的结果与我曾经使用过的大多数COBOL实现所获得的结果是一致的 BINARY-xxx USAGE COMP 比 USAGE DISPLAY 和 USAGE BINARY-LONG （以及其他BINARY- xxx用法）具有显着的性能优势。在测试的测量误差范围内，性能也一样。

trans-unit.source: The results I saw here were consistent with those that would have been obtained from most of the COBOL implementations I have ever worked with —USAGE COMPhas a significant performance advantage overUSAGE DISPLAYandUSAGE BINARY-LONG(and presumably the otherBINARY-xxxusages as well) perform identically, within the measurement tolerances of the test.
trans-unit.target: 我在这里看到的结果与我曾经使用过的大多数COBOL实现所获得的结果是一致的 BINARY-xxx USAGE COMP 比 USAGE DISPLAY 和 USAGE BINARY-LONG （以及其他BINARY- xxx用法）具有显着的性能优势。在测试的测量误差范围内，性能也一样。

trans-unit.source: The return code of the operation is returned both in the <
trans-unit.target: 该操作的返回码在<

trans-unit.source: The return code of the operation is returned both in the result argument (any non-edited numeric identifier) as well as in the RETURN-CODE special register (see Special Registers). The return code of the operation will be either 0=Success or 128=failure.
trans-unit.target: 在 result 参数（任何未编辑的数字标识符）以及 RETURN-CODE 特殊寄存器（请参见特殊寄存器）中都返回操作的返回码。该操作的返回码将为0 = Success或128 = failure。

trans-unit.source: The return code of the operation, which will be either 0=Success or 128=failure, is returned in the RETURN-CODE special register (see Special Registers).
trans-unit.target: 该操作的返回码为0 =成功或128 =失败，将在 RETURN-CODE 特殊寄存器中返回（请参见特殊寄存器）。

trans-unit.source: The second can perform an extremely fast search against a table sorted by and searched against a key field contained in each table entry. The algorithm used for such a search is a binary search (also known as a half-interval search). This algorithm ensures that only a small number of entries in the table need to be checked in order to find a desired entry or to determine that the desired entry doesn’t exist in the table. The larger the table, the more effective this search becomes. For example, a binary search of a table containing 32,768 entries will be able to locate a particular entry or determine the entry doesn’t exist by looking at no more than fifteen (15) entries! The algorithm is explained in detail in the documentation of theSEARCH ALLstatement (see SEARCH ALL).
trans-unit.target: 第二种方法可以对每个表条目中包含的键字段进行排序并对其进行搜索的表执行极其快速的搜索。用于这种搜索的算法是二进制搜索（也称为半间隔搜索）。该算法确保只需要检查表中的少量条目即可找到所需的条目或确定所需的条目在表中不存在。表越大，此搜索越有效。例如，对包含32,768个条目的表进行二进制搜索将能够查找特定条目或通过查看不超过十五（15）个条目来确定该条目不存在！ SEARCH ALL 语句的文档中详细说明了该算法（请参阅SEARCH ALL）。

trans-unit.source: The sequence in which the characters that are acceptable to a computer are ordered for purposes of all types of sorting, merging, comparing, and processing. GnuCOBOL programs may utilize standard character-set collating sequences (such as that defined by the ASCII or EBCDIC character sets) or programmer-defined custom sequences as specified in the OBJECT-COMPUTER paragraph (section 4.1.2) and defined in the SPECIAL-NAMES paragraph (section 4.1.4).
trans-unit.target: 为了进行各种类型的排序、合并、比较和处理,对计算机可接受的字符进行排序的序列。GnuCOBOL程序可以使用标准字符集整理序列(如ASCII或EBCDIC字符集所定义的序列),也可以使用程序员定义的自定义序列,如OBJECT-COMPUTER段(4.1.2节)中规定的和SPECIAL-NAMES段(4.1.4节)中定义的。

trans-unit.source: The sign indicator will have a value of a hexadecimal A through F. Traditional packed decimal encoding rules call for hexadecimal values of F, A, C or E ("FACE") in the sign nibble to indicate a positive value and B or D to represent a negative value (hexadecimal digits 0-9 are undefined). Testing with a Windows MinGW/GnuCOBOL implementation shows that – in fact – hex digit D represents a negative number and any other hexadecimal digit denotes a positive number. Therefore, aPIC S9(3) COMP-3packed-decimal field with a value of -15 would be stored internally as a hexadecimal 015D in GnuCOBOL.
trans-unit.target: 符号指示符的值将为十六进制的A到F。传统的压缩十进制编码规则要求符号半字节中的F，A，C或E（“ FACE”）的十六进制值表示正值，而B或D表示正值。代表负值（未定义十六进制数字0-9）。使用Windows MinGW / GnuCOBOL实现进行的测试显示– –实际上–十六进制数字D表示负数，而其他十六进制数字表示正数。因此，值为-15 的 PIC S9(3) COMP-3 压缩十进制字段将作为十六进制015D内部存储在GnuCOBOL中。

Testing with a Windows MinGW/GnuCOBOL implementation shows that — in fact — hex digit D represents a negative number and any other hexadecimal digit denotes a positive number. Therefore, a PIC S9(3) COMP-3 packed-decimal field with a value of -15 would be stored internally as a hexadecimal 015D in GnuCOBOL.

trans-unit.source: The term ’available screen area’ is a nebulous one in those environments where command-line shell sessions are invoked within a graphical user-interface environment, as will be the case on Windows, OSX and most Unix/Linux systems — these environments allow command-line session windows to exist with a variable number of available screen rows and columns. When you are designing GnuCOBOL screens, you need to do so with an awareness of the logical screen row/column geometry the program will be executing within.
trans-unit.target: 在那些在图形用户界面环境中调用命令行shell会话的环境中，“可用屏幕区域”一词是一个模糊的地方，在Windows，OSX和大多数Unix / Linux系统中就是这种情况-这些环境允许命令行会话窗口存在，并具有可变数量的可用屏幕行和列。在设计GnuCOBOL屏幕时，需要了解程序将在其中执行的逻辑屏幕行/列几何形状。

trans-unit.source: The value of this variable (an integer) will be used to define how much memory will be allocated for use in sorting. If the value is 1048576 or greater, that value will be used "as is" as the amount of memory (in bytes) to allocate. If the value is less than 1048576, the value will specify how many MB of memory will be allocated. The default sort memory amount is 128 MB.
trans-unit.target: 这个变量的值(一个整数)将被用来定义分配多少内存用于排序。如果该值为1048576或更大,该值将被 "原样 "用作分配的内存量(以字节为单位)。如果该值小于1048576,该值将指定将分配多少MB的内存。默认的排序内存量是128 MB。

trans-unit.source: The various I/O statements your program can execute are capable of imposing limitations on access by other concurrently-executing programs to the file record they just accessed. These limitations are syntactically imposed by placing a lock on the record using a LOCK clause. Other records in the file remain available, assuming that file-sharing limitations imposed at the time the file was opened didn’t prevent access to the entire file.
trans-unit.target: 您的程序可以执行的各种I / O语句能够对其他同时执行的程序对其刚访问的文件记录的访问施加限制。通过使用 LOCK 子句在记录上加锁，可以从句法上强加这些限制。假设打开文件时施加的文件共享限制不会阻止访问整个文件，则文件中的其他记录仍然可用。

trans-unit.source: The various I/O statements your program can execute are capable of imposing limitations on access by other concurrently-executing programs to the file record they just accessed. These limitations are syntactically imposed by placing a lock on the record using aLOCKclause. Other records in the file remain available, assuming that file-sharing limitations imposed at the time the file was opened didn’t prevent access to the entire file.
trans-unit.target: 您的程序可以执行的各种I / O语句能够限制其他同时执行的程序对他们刚访问的文件记录的访问。通过使用 LOCK 子句在记录上加锁，可以从句法上强加这些限制。假定打开文件时施加的文件共享限制不会阻止访问整个文件，则文件中的其他记录仍然可用。

trans-unit.source: The whole reason you’re reading this is that you’ve discovered GnuCOBOL — another implementation of COBOL in addition to those mentioned earlier. The distinguishing characteristic of GnuCOBOL versus those others is that GnuCOBOL is FREE open-source and therefore FREE to obtain and use. It is community-enhanced and community-supported. Later in this document (see So What is GnuCOBOL?), you’ll begin to learn more about this COBOL implementation’s capabilities.
trans-unit.target: 阅读本文的全部原因是您发现了GnuCOBOL —除了前面提到的那些之外，COBOL的另一种实现。GnuCOBOL与其他GNUCOBOL的区别在于，GnuCOBOL是免费的开放源代码，因此免费获得和使用。它是社区增强和社区支持的。在本文档的后面（请参阅So什么是GnuCOBOL？），您将开始学习有关此COBOL实现功能的更多信息。

trans-unit.source: The*operator computes the product of the left and right arguments while the/operator computes the value of the left argument divided by the value of the right argument. If the right argument has a value of zero, expression evaluation will be prematurely terminated before a value is generated. This may cause program failure at run-time.
trans-unit.target: 将 * 操作符计算的左，右争论的产物，而 / 操作计算由右参数的值除以左边参数的值。如果right参数的值为零，则在生成值之前会过早终止表达式求值。这可能会在运行时导致程序失败。

trans-unit.source: The*symbol is not allowed in conjunction withN
trans-unit.target: 的 * 符号是不允许会同 N

trans-unit.source: The+operator calculates the sum of the left and right arguments while the-operator computes the value of the right argument subtracted from that of the left argument.
trans-unit.target: 在 + 运算符计算，而左，右参数的总和 - 运算符计算从左边参数中减去右边的参数的值。

trans-unit.source: The+symbol is not allowed in conjunction withN
trans-unit.target: 不允许将 + 符号与 N 结合使用

trans-unit.source: The,symbol is not allowed in conjunction withN
trans-unit.target: 的 , 符号是不允许会同 N

trans-unit.source: The,symbol serves as a thousands separator. Many times, you’ll see large numbers formatted with these symbols — for example, 123,456,789. This can be accomplished easily by adding thousands separator symbols to a picture string. Thousands separator symbols that aren’t needed will behave as if they were9.
trans-unit.target: 的 , 符号作为千位分隔符。很多时候，您会看到大量用这些符号格式化的数字，例如123,456,789。通过在图片字符串中添加数千个分隔符，可以轻松实现此目的。成千上万个不需要的分隔符将表现为 9 。

trans-unit.source: The-symbol is not allowed in conjunction withN
trans-unit.target: 的 - 符号是不允许会同 N

trans-unit.source: The.symbol inserts a decimal point into a numeric field value. When the contents of a numeric data item sending field are moved into a receiving data item whose picture clause contains the.editing symbol, implied V or actual decimal point in the sending data item or literal, respectively, will be aligned with the.symbol in the receiving field. Digits are then transferred from the sending to the receiving field outward from the sending field’s "V" or ".", truncating sending digits if there aren’t enough positions in the receiving field. Any digit positions in the receiving field that don’t receive digits from the sending field, if any, will be set to 0.
trans-unit.target: 的 . 符号将小数点插入数字字段值。将数字数据项发送字段的内容移入其图片子句包含的接收数据项时 . 编辑符号，发送数据项或文字中的隐含 V 或实际小数点将分别与对齐 . 接收字段中的符号。然后，将数字从发送字段从发送字段的“ V”或“。”向外传送到接收字段，如果接收字段中没有足够的位置，则会截断发送数字。接收字段中未从发送字段接收数字的任何数字位置（如果有）将被设置为0。

trans-unit.source: The.symbol is not allowed in conjunction withN
trans-unit.target: 的 . 不允许将符号与 N 结合使用

trans-unit.source: The/editing symbol inserts one "/" character into the field value for each occurrence in the picture string.
trans-unit.target: 的 / 编辑符号插入一个“/”字符到用于在图形串每次出现时的域值。

trans-unit.source: The0(zero) editing symbol introduces one "0" character into the field value for each occurrence in the picture string.

trans-unit.source: TheADVANCING PAGEclause will introduce the appropriate number of line-terminator character sequences into the file either before the written record AFTER ADVANCING or after the written record BEFORE ADVANCING so as to force the printer to automatically advance to a new sheet of paper when the file prints. No formfeed characters will be generated whenLINAGEis specified — instead, it is assumed that the printer to which the report will be printed will be loaded with special forms that conform to the specifications defined by theLINAGEclause.
trans-unit.target: 的 ADVANCING PAGE 子句将书面记录之前引入线-终止字符序列的适当数目到该文件中任一 AFTER ADVANCING 或书面记录后 BEFORE ADVANCING 以便打印机强制自动前进到的纸张时，该文件一个新的工作表打印。当指定 LINAGE 时，将不生成换页符-而是假定将要打印报告的打印机将加载符合 LINAGE 子句所定义规范的特殊格式。

trans-unit.source: TheCOMPUTEstatement supports exponentiation (via the "**" operator) — there is no equivalent basic arithmetic statement. Although you could simulate integral exponentiation (raising a value to the third power, for example) usingMULTIPLYstatements, and you may use theSQRTintrinsic function (see SQRT) to find a square root, there’s just no (easy) way to find the cube-root of a value without using theCOMPUTEstatement.
trans-unit.target: 该 COMPUTE 语句支持幂（通过“**”运算符） -有没有相应的基本运算的语句。尽管您可以使用 MULTIPLY 语句模拟积分乘幂（例如，将值提高至三次方），并且可以使用 SQRT 内在函数（请参见SQRT）来找到平方根，但没有（简便）的方法可以找到平方根。不使用 COMPUTE 语句的值的立方根。

trans-unit.source: TheEmployeedata item consists of two subordinate data items — anEmployee-Nameand anEmployment-Datesdata item (presumably there would be a lot of others too, but we don’t care about them right now). As the diagram shows, each of those data items are, in turn, broken down into subordinate data items. This hierarchy of data items can get ratherdeep and GnuCOBOL, like other COBOL implementations, can handle up to 49 levels of such hierarchical structures.
trans-unit.target: 该 Employee 数据项目由下属两个数据项-一个 Employee-Name 和 Employment-Dates 数据项（想必会有很多人的太多，但我们现在不关心他们）。如图所示，依次将这些数据项分解为从属数据项。数据项的层次结构可能会变得 deep ，GnuCOBOL像其他COBOL实现一样，可以处理多达49个级别的此类层次结构。

trans-unit.source: TheFULLclause forces the user to enter data into the field it is specified on (or into all subordinate input-capable fields if specified on a group item) sufficient to fill every character position of the field.
trans-unit.target: 的 FULL 子句迫使用户将数据输入到其上（或成如果在一组项指定所有从属输入功能的字段）足以填充字段的每一个字符位置中指定的字段。

trans-unit.source: TheGLOBAL(see GLOBAL) option, if used, allows a declarative procedure to be used across the program containing theUSEstatement and any subprograms nested within that program.
trans-unit.target: 在 GLOBAL （参见GLOBAL）的选项，如果使用的话，允许跨越包含的程序中使用的说明性过程 USE 语句和嵌套在该程序内的任何子程序。

trans-unit.source: TheGLOBALclause may only be specified at the 77 or 01 level.
trans-unit.target: 在 GLOBAL 子句可以仅在77或01级指定。

trans-unit.source: TheGROUP INDICATEclause specifies that the data item in whose definition the clause appears will be presented only in very limited circumstances.

trans-unit.source: TheINSPECTstatement will make a single pass through the sequence of characters comprising the inspect subject. As the pointer to the current inspect target character reaches a point where it falls within the explicit or implicit target ranges specified on the operational instructions of the two clauses, the actions specified by those instructions will become eligible to be taken. As the character pointer reaches a point where it falls past the end of target ranges, the instructions belonging to those target ranges will become disabled.
trans-unit.target: 该 INSPECT 语句将使通过包含所述检查对象的字符序列单程。当指向当前检查目标字符的指针到达这两个子句的操作指令中指定的显式或隐式目标范围内的点时，由这些指令指定的动作将可以执行。当字符指针到达超出目标范围末端的点时，属于那些目标范围的指令将被禁用。

trans-unit.source: TheLINEandCOLUMNclauses provide one mechanism for specifying the line and column position to which the cursor will be positioned before allowing the user to enter data. In the absence of one or the other, a value of 1 will be assumed for the one that is missing. The author’s personal preference, however, is to explicitly code both.

trans-unit.source: TheUSAGEclause defines the format that will be used to store the value of a data item.

trans-unit.source: TheUSAGEspecificationsFLOAT-DECIMAL-16andFLOAT-DECIMAL-34will encode data using IEEE 754Decimal64andDecimal128format, respectively. The former allows for up to 16 digits of exact precision while the latter offers 34. The phrase "exact precision" is used because the traditional binary renderings of decimal real numbers in a floating-point format FLOAT-LONGandFLOAT-SHORT for example) only yield an approximation of the actual value because many decimal fractions cannot be precisely rendered in binary. The Decimal64 and Decimal128 renderings, however, render decimal real numbers in encoded decimal form in much the same way thatPACKED-DECIMALrenders a decimal integer in digit-by-digit decimal form. The exact manner in which this rendering is performed is complex (Wikipedia has an excellent article on the subject  just search forDecimal64.
trans-unit.target: 所述 USAGE 规格 FLOAT-DECIMAL-16 和 FLOAT-DECIMAL-34 将使用IEEE 754编码数据 Decimal64 和 Decimal128 格式分别。前者最多允许16位数字的精确精度，而后者则允许34位精度。之所以使用短语“精确精度”，是因为以浮点格式 FLOAT-LONG 和 FLOAT-SHORT 表示的十进制实数的传统二进制表示形式）只能得出实际值的近似值，因为许多小数部分不能精确地用二进制表示。但是，Decimal64和Decimal128渲染以编码的十进制形式渲染十进制实数，其方式与 PACKED-DECIMAL 几乎相同以逐位十进制形式呈现一个十进制整数。进行渲染的确切方式很复杂（Wikipedia在该主题上有出色的文章–仅搜索 Decimal64 即可。

trans-unit.source: TheUSAGEspecificationsFLOAT-LONGandFLOAT-SHORTuse the IEEE 754Binary64andBinary32formats, respectively. These are binary encodings of real decimal numbers, and as such cannot represent every possible value between the minimum and maximum values in the range for those usages. Wikipedia has an excellent article on the Binary64 and Binary32 encoding schemes  just search onBinary32orBinary64
trans-unit.target: 该 USAGE 规范 FLOAT-LONG 和 FLOAT-SHORT 使用IEEE 754 Binary64 和 Binary32 分别格式。这些是实十进制数字的二进制编码，因此不能表示这些用法范围内的最小值和最大值之间的所有可能值。Wikipedia上有一篇关于Binary64和Binary32编码方案的出色文章–只需在 Binary32 或 Binary64 上搜索

trans-unit.source: There have been programming languages designed specifically for the processing of text strings, and there have been programming languages designed for the sole purpose of performing high-powered numerical computations. Most programming languages fall somewhere in the middle.
trans-unit.target: 有专门为处理文本字符串而设计的编程语言,也有专门为进行高能数值计算而设计的编程语言。大多数编程语言介于两者之间。

trans-unit.source: There is never an issue of exactly what the length of a string contained in a USAGE DISPLAY (see USAGE) data item is — there are always exactly how ever many characters as were allowed for by the PICTURE clause. In the example above, LastName will always contain exactly fifteen characters; of course, there may be anywhere from 0 to 15 trailing SPACES as part of the current LastName value.
trans-unit.target: 永远不会存在 USAGE DISPLAY （请参阅USAGE）数据项中包含的字符串的长度到底是多少的问题 PICTURE 子句始终会精确地允许多少个字符。在上面的示例中， LastName 将始终准确包含15个字符；当然，作为当前LastName值的一部分，尾随空格可能在0到15之间。

trans-unit.source: There is never an issue of exactly what the length of a string contained in aUSAGE DISPLAY(see USAGE) data item is — there are always exactly how ever many characters as were allowed for by thePICTUREclause. In the example above, "LastName" will always contain exactly fifteen characters; of course, there may be anywhere from 0 to 15 trailing SPACES as part of the current LastName value.

trans-unit.source: There may be any number of alternate keys, but each key field comes with a disk space penalty as well as an execution time penalty. As the number of alternate key fields increases, it will take longer and longer to write and/or modify records in the file.

trans-unit.source: There may be times where this is exactly what you were looking for. More often than not, however, this is not desirable behaviour. Suggestion: use a copybook to describe the record layouts of any file; this guarantees that multiple programs accessing that file will "see" the same record sizes and layouts by coding aCOPYstatement (see COPY) to import the record layout(s) rather than hand-coding them.
trans-unit.target: 有时候，这正是您想要的。但是，这通常不是可取的行为。建议：使用习字簿来描述任何文件的记录布局；这样可以保证访问该文件的多个程序通过编码 COPY 语句（请参阅COPY）以导入记录布局（而不是手工编码）来“查看”相同的记录大小和布局。

trans-unit.source: There may be times where this is exactly what you were looking for. More often than not, however, this is not desirable behaviour. Suggestion: use a copybook to describe the record layouts of any file; this guarantees that multiple programs accessing that file will “see” the same record sizes and layouts by coding a COPY statement (see COPY) to import the record layout(s) rather than hand-coding them.
trans-unit.target: 有时候，这正是您想要的。但是，这通常不是可取的行为。建议：使用习字簿来描述任何文件的记录布局；这样可以保证访问该文件的多个程序通过编码 COPY 语句（请参阅COPY）以导入记录布局（而不是手工编码）来“查看”相同的记录大小和布局。

trans-unit.source: There will be multiple structures stored for an INDEXED file. The first will be a data component, which may be thought of as being similar to the internal structure of a relative file. Data records may not, however, be directly accessed by their record number as would be the case with a relative file, nor may they be processed sequentially by their physical sequence in the file.
trans-unit.target: INDEXED 文件将存储多个结构。第一个将是数据组件，可以认为它类似于相对文件的内部结构。但是，数据记录不能像相对文件那样直接通过记录号直接访问，也不能通过其在文件中的物理顺序进行顺序处理。

trans-unit.source: There will be multiple structures stored for anINDEXEDfile. The first will be a data component, which may be thought of as being similar to the internal structure of a relative file. Data records may not, however, be directly accessed by their record number as would be the case with a relative file, nor may they be processed sequentially by their physical sequence in the file.
trans-unit.target: INDEXED 文件将存储多个结构。第一个将是数据组件，可以认为它类似于相对文件的内部结构。但是，数据记录不能像相对文件那样直接通过记录号直接访问，也不能通过文件中的物理顺序依次处理。

trans-unit.source: These are alphanumeric literals whose character sequence is specified by hexadecimal value. These literals are formed by a quote- or apostrophe-delimited sequence of an even number of hexadecimal digits (upper- or lower-case), prefixed with the letter "X" (also upper- or lower-case). For example, the character string "Demo" could be specified as the hexadecimal alphanumeric literalX'44656D6F' assuming the ASCII character set. See Alphanumeric Literals.
trans-unit.target: 这些是字母数字文字，其字符序列由十六进制值指定。这些文字由偶数个十六进制数字（大写或小写）加引号或撇号分隔的序列组成，并以字母“ X”（大写或小写）为前缀。例如，可以将字符串“ Demo”指定为十六进制的字母数字文字 X'44656D6F' (假设使用ASCII字符集）。参见字母数字文字。

trans-unit.source: These are data items a COBOL program will be working with. The vast majority of identifiers are defined by the user (programmer) while a few are pre-defined by the GnuCOBOL compiler. Identifiers pre-defined by the compiler are referred to as special registers. Other programming languages generally refer to identifiers as "variables".
trans-unit.target: 这些都是COBOL程序将要处理的数据项。绝大多数标识符是由用户(程序员)定义的,而少数标识符是由GnuCOBOL编译器预先定义的。编译器预先定义的标识符被称为特殊寄存器。其他编程语言一般将标识符称为 "变量"。

trans-unit.source: These are data items a COBOL program will be working with. The vast majority of identifiers are defined by the user (programmer) while a few are pre-defined by the GnuCOBOL compiler. Identifiers pre-defined by the compiler are referred to as special registers. Other programming languages generally refer to identifiers as “variables”.
trans-unit.target: 这些是COBOL程序将使用的数据项。绝大多数标识符由用户（程序员）定义，而少数标识符由GnuCOBOL编译器预定义。由编译器预定义的标识符称为特殊寄存器。其他编程语言通常将标识符称为“变量”。

trans-unit.source: These are dynamically-loadable object code files ready to be invoked from other programs at execution time. On Windows systems, these would be

trans-unit.source: These are dynamically-loadable object code files ready to be invoked from other programs at execution time. On Windows systems, these would be ".dll" files, while on Unix systems they are typically ".so" files (OSX uses ".dylib").
trans-unit.target: 这些都是可动态加载的对象代码文件,可以在执行时被其他程序调用。在Windows系统中,这些文件是".dll "文件,而在Unix系统中,它们通常是".so "文件(OSX使用".dylib")。

trans-unit.source: These are files with an internal structure similar to that of a line sequential file. These files are defined (without an explicit ORGANIZATION specification) using the LINE ADVANCING clause on their SELECT statement (see SELECT).
trans-unit.target: 这些文件的内部结构类似于行顺序文件。这些文件是在其 SELECT 语句（请参阅SELECT）上使用 LINE ADVANCING 子句定义的（没有明确的 ORGANIZATION 规范）。

trans-unit.source: These are files with an internal structure similar to that of a line sequential file. These files are defined (without an explicitORGANIZATIONspecification) using theLINE ADVANCINGclause on theirSELECTstatement (see SELECT).

trans-unit.source: These are files with the simplest of all internal structures. Their contents are structured simply as a series of identically- or differently-sized data records, each terminated by a special end-of-record delimiter character. An ASCII line-feed character (hexadecimal 0A) is the end-of-record delimiter character used by any UNIX or pseudo-UNIX (MinGW, Cygwin, OSX) GnuCOBOL build. A truly native Windows build would use a carriage-return, line-feed (hexadecimal 0D0A) sequence.
trans-unit.target: 这些文件具有最简单的内部结构。它们的内容结构很简单,就是一系列相同或不同大小的数据记录,每个记录都由一个特殊的记录末尾定界符结束。ASCII行进位字符(十六进制0A)是任何UNIX或伪UNIX(MinGW、Cygwin、OSX)GnuCOBOL构建中使用的记录结束定界符。真正的原生Windows构建将使用回车、换行(十六进制0D0A)序列。

trans-unit.source: These default initialization rules can vary quite substantially from one COBOL implementation to another. For example, it is quite common for data division storage to be initialized to all binary zeros except for those data items where VALUE clauses are present. Take care when working with applications originally developed for another COBOL implementation to ensure that GnuCOBOL’s default initialization rules won’t prove disruptive.
trans-unit.target: 从一个COBOL实现到另一个COBOL实现，这些默认的初始化规则可能会有很大的不同。例如，除了存在 VALUE 子句的那些数据项外，将数据除法存储初始化为所有二进制零是很常见的。在使用最初为另一个COBOL实现开发的应用程序时，请务必小心，以确保GnuCOBOL的默认初始化规则不会造成破坏。

trans-unit.source: These default initialization rules can vary quite substantially from one COBOL implementation to another. For example, it is quite common for data division storage to be initialized to all binary zeros except for those data items whereVALUEclauses are present. Take care when working with applications originally developed for another COBOL implementation to ensure that GnuCOBOL’s default initialization rules won’t prove disruptive.
trans-unit.target: 从一个COBOL实现到另一个COBOL实现，这些默认的初始化规则可能会有很大的不同。例如，将数据除法存储初始化为所有二进制零是很常见的，除了那些存在 VALUE 子句的数据项。在使用最初为另一个COBOL实现开发的应用程序时，请务必小心，以确保GnuCOBOL的默认初始化规则不会造成破坏。

trans-unit.source: These devices (they are all synonymous) represent standard system input (pipe 0). On a PC or UNIX system, this is typically the keyboard. The contents of a file may be delivered to a GnuCOBOL program for access via one of these device names by adding the sequence "0< filename" to the end of the programs execution command.
trans-unit.target: 这些设备（它们都是同义词）代表标准系统输入（管道0）。在PC或UNIX系统上，这通常是键盘。通过将序列“ 0 <文件名”添加到程序执行命令的末尾，可以通过这些设备名称之一将文件的内容传递到GnuCOBOL程序进行访问。

trans-unit.source: These devices (they are all synonymous) represent standard system output (pipe 1). On a PC or UNIX system, this is typically the display. Output sent to one of these devices by a GnuCOBOL program can be sent to a file by adding the sequence "1> filename" to the end of the programs execution command.
trans-unit.target: 这些设备（它们都是同义词）代表标准系统输出（管道1）。在PC或UNIX系统上，通常是显示器。通过在程序执行命令的末尾添加序列“ 1> filename”，可以将GnuCOBOL程序发送到这些设备之一的输出发送到文件。

trans-unit.source: These devices (they are synonymous) represent standard system error output (pipe 2). On a PC or UNIX system, this is typically the display. Output sent to one of these devices by a GnuCOBOL program can be sent to a file by adding the sequence "2> filename" to the end of the programs execution command.

trans-unit.source: These features allow fields to be displayed at specific row/column positions, various colors and video attributes to be assigned to screen fields and the pressing of specific function keys (F1, F2, …) to be detectable. All of this takes place through the auspices of the SCREEN SECTION (see SCREEN SECTION) and special formats of the ACCEPT statement (see ACCEPT) and the DISPLAY statement (see DISPLAY).
trans-unit.target: 这些功能允许将字段显示在特定的行/列位置，将各种颜色和视频属性分配给屏幕字段，并且可以检测到特定功能键（F1，F2等）的按下。所有这些都是通过 SCREEN SECTION （请参阅SCREEN SECTION）的主持以及 ACCEPT 语句（请参阅ACCEPT）和 DISPLAY 语句（请参见DISPLAY）的特殊格式进行的。

trans-unit.source: These features allow fields to be displayed at specific row/column positions, various colors and video attributes to be assigned to screen fields and the pressing of specific function keys (F1, F2, …) to be detectable. All of this takes place through the auspices of theSCREEN SECTION(see SCREEN SECTION) and special formats of theACCEPTstatement (see ACCEPT) and theDISPLAYstatement (see DISPLAY).
trans-unit.target: 这些功能允许将字段显示在特定的行/列位置，将各种颜色和视频属性分配给屏幕字段，并且可以检测到特定功能键（F1，F2等）的按下。所有这些都是通过 SCREEN SECTION （请参阅SCREEN SECTION）以及 ACCEPT 语句（请参阅ACCEPT）和 DISPLAY 语句（请参见DISPLAY）的特殊格式进行的。

trans-unit.source: These files
trans-unit.target: 这些文件

trans-unit.source: These files also have a simple internal structure. Their contents are structured simply as an arbitrarily-long sequence of data characters. This sequence of characters will be treated as a series of fixed-length records simply by logically splitting the sequence of characters up into fixed-length segments, each as long as the maximum record size defined in the program. There are no special end-of-record delimiter characters in the file and when the file is written to by a GnuCOBOL program, no delimiter sequence is appended to the data.
trans-unit.target: 这些文件的内部结构也很简单。它们的内容结构简单,是一个任意长的数据字符序列。这个字符序列将被视为一系列固定长度的记录,只需将字符序列逻辑地分割成固定长度的段,每个段的长度与程序中定义的最大记录大小相同。文件中没有特殊的记录结束定界符,当GnuCOBOL程序将文件写入时,不会将定界符序列附加到数据上。

trans-unit.source: These files are files with an internal organization such that records may be processed in a sequential manner based upon their physical location in the file or in a random manner by allowing records to be read, written or updated by specifying the relative record number in the file.
trans-unit.target: 这些文件是具有内部组织结构的文件,可以根据记录在文件中的物理位置按顺序进行处理,也可以通过指定文件中的相对记录号,允许对记录进行读、写或更新,以随机方式进行处理。

trans-unit.source: These files can contain exact binary data fields. The contents of record fields are irrelevant to the reading process as there is no end-of-record delimiter.
trans-unit.target: 这些文件可以包含精确的二进制数据字段。记录字段的内容与读取过程无关,因为没有记录结束的定界符。

trans-unit.source: These files cannot be prepared with any standard text-editing or word processing software as all such programs will embed delimiter characters at the end of records (use ORGANIZATION IS LINE SEQUENTIAL instead).
trans-unit.target: 这些文件无法使用任何标准的文本编辑或文字处理软件进行准备，因为所有此类程序都会在记录的末尾嵌入定界符（请改用 ORGANIZATION IS LINE SEQUENTIAL ）。

trans-unit.source: These files cannot be prepared with any standard text-editing or word processing software as all such programs will embed delimiter characters at the end of records (useORGANIZATION IS LINE SEQUENTIALinstead).
trans-unit.target: 这些文件无法使用任何标准的文本编辑或文字处理软件进行准备，因为所有此类程序都会在记录的末尾嵌入定界符（请改用 ORGANIZATION IS LINE SEQUENTIAL ）。

trans-unit.source: These files may be created with any standard text-editing or word processing software capable of writing text files. Such files should not contain any USAGE COMPUTATIONAL or BINARY (of any variety) data since such fields could accidentally contain byte sequences that could be interpreted as an end-of-record delimiter.
trans-unit.target: 这些文件可以使用任何能够编写文本文件的标准文本编辑或文字处理软件来创建。此类文件不应包含任何 USAGE COMPUTATIONAL 或 BINARY （任何种类的）数据，因为此类字段可能会意外地包含可被解释为记录结束定界符的字节序列。

trans-unit.source: These files may be created with any standard text-editing or word processing software capable of writing text files. Such files should not contain anyUSAGE COMPUTATIONALorBINARY(of any variety) data since such fields could accidentally contain byte sequences that could be interpreted as an end-of-record delimiter.
trans-unit.target: 这些文件可以使用任何能够编写文本文件的标准文本编辑或文字处理软件来创建。此类文件不应包含任何 USAGE COMPUTATIONAL 或 BINARY （任何种类的）数据，因为此类字段可能偶然包含可被解释为记录结束定界符的字节序列。

trans-unit.source: These files may contain either USAGE DISPLAY or USAGE COMPUTATIONAL (of any variety) data since no binary data sequence can be accidentally interpreted as an end-of-record delimiter.
trans-unit.target: 这些文件可能包含“ USAGE DISPLAY 或“ USAGE COMPUTATIONAL （各种形式）数据，因为没有任何二进制数据序列可能会被意外地解释为记录结束定界符。

trans-unit.source: These files may contain eitherUSAGE DISPLAYorUSAGE COMPUTATIONAL(of any variety) data since no binary data sequence can be accidentally interpreted as an end-of-record delimiter.
trans-unit.target: 这些文件可能包含“ USAGE DISPLAY 或“ USAGE COMPUTATIONAL （任何种类）数据，因为没有任何二进制数据序列可以被意外地解释为记录结束定界符。

trans-unit.source: These files should not be defined to contain any exact binary data fields because the contents of those fields could inadvertently have the end-of-record sequence as part of their values — this would confuse the runtime system when reading the file, and it would interpret that value as an actual end-of-record sequence.
trans-unit.target: 这些文件不应定义为包含任何确切的二进制数据字段，因为这些字段的内容可能会无意中将记录结束序列作为其值的一部分-这会在读取文件时混淆运行时系统，并且会解释该值作为实际的记录结束序列。

trans-unit.source: These groups will be presented (printed) across however many formatted pages are necessary to hold them. No single report group will be allowed to cross page boundaries.
trans-unit.target: 这些报告组将在必要的格式化页面上显示(打印),以容纳它们。任何一个报告组都不允许跨越页面边界。

trans-unit.source: These sizes conform to the COBOL standard and the minimum sizes of the COBOL types are the same as the minimum sizes of the corresponding C data types. There’s no official compatibility between them. Note that values in square braces ’[]’ are the defaults.
trans-unit.target: 这些大小符合COBOL标准，并且COBOL类型的最小大小与相应的C数据类型的最小大小相同。它们之间没有官方的兼容性。请注意，方括号“ []”中的值是默认值。

trans-unit.source: They conform to the principles of Object-Oriented Programming (OOP). This is desired for one major reason — it facilitates "code re-usability", thus improving the productivity of programmers by allowing them to re-use previously written (and debugged) code in new applications. For one reason or another, COBOL is perceived as being weak in this regard. It isn’t (especially today), as we’ll see in the next section, but perception is important.
trans-unit.target: 它们符合面向对象编程（OOP）的原理。之所以需要这样做是出于一个主要原因-它促进了“代码的可重用性”，从而通过允许程序员在新的应用程序中重用先前编写（和调试）的代码来提高程序员的生产率。由于一个或另一个原因，在这方面，COBOL被认为是薄弱的。并非如此（特别是在今天），正如我们将在下一部分中看到的那样，但是感知很重要。

trans-unit.source: This action resets the global exception object completely (FUNCTION EXCEPTION-{FILE, LOCATION, STATEMENT, STATUS } ), and will not show anything afterwards), no matter what the last exception was (such as a divide by zero). Use with care.
trans-unit.target: 这个操作完全重置全局异常对象(FUNCTION EXCEPTION-{FILE,LOCATION,STATEMENT,STATUS }),之后不会显示任何东西),不管最后的异常是什么(比如被零除)。使用时要注意。

trans-unit.source: This behaviour when the argument is defined asPIC 9may be unacceptable, as an argument defined asPIC 9(3)but passed in a value of "1" from the command line will receive a value of "100", not "001". Consider defining "numeric" command line arguments asPIC Xand then using theNUMVALintrinsic function (see NUMVAL) function to determine the proper numeric value.
trans-unit.target: 当参数定义为 PIC 9 时，此行为可能是不可接受的，因为定义为 PIC 9(3) 但从命令行传递了值“ 1”的参数将收到值“ 100”，而不是“ 001” 。考虑将“数字”命令行参数定义为 PIC X ，然后使用 NUMVAL 内在函数（请参见NUMVAL）确定适当的数值。

trans-unit.source: This chapter describes the syntax, semantics and usage of the COBOL programming language as implemented by the current version of GnuCOBOL. For the rest of this document the Language is spelt as COBOL to ease reading however the compiler name retains the mixed case of GnuCOBOL.
trans-unit.target: 本章描述了当前版本的GnuCOBOL所实现的COBOL编程语言的语法、语义和用法。在本文档的其余部分,为了方便阅读,语言的拼写为COBOL,但是编译器的名称保留了GnuCOBOL的混合字母。

trans-unit.source: This clause, along with HIGHLIGHT (see HIGHLIGHT), are intended to provide a three-level intensity scheme (LOWLIGHT … nothing (Normal) … HIGHLIGHT). In environments such as a Windows console where only two levels of intensity are supported, LOWLIGHT is the same as leaving this clause off altogether.

trans-unit.source: This directive instructs the compiler how to treat references to program names and may be used to determine other details for interacting with a function or program. There are four options with COBOL being the default.

trans-unit.source: This document describes the syntax, semantics and use of the COBOL programming language as implemented by GnuCOBOL, formerly known as OpenCOBOL.
trans-unit.target: 本文档描述了由GnuCOBOL(以前称为OpenCOBOL)实现的COBOL编程语言的语法、语义和使用。

trans-unit.source: This document is intended to serve as a full-function reference and user’s guide suitable for both those readers learning COBOL for the first time as usage as a training tool, as well as those already familiar with some dialect of the COBOL language.
trans-unit.target: 本文档旨在作为功能全面的参考书和用户指南，适合首次作为学习工具使用COBOL的读者，以及已经熟悉COBOL语言某些方言的读者。

trans-unit.source: This file organization was defined to accommodate either sequential or random processing. With a RELATIVE file, it is possible to read or write record 100 directly, without having to have first read or written records 1-99. The GnuCOBOL runtime system uses the program-defined maximum record size to calculate a relative byte position in the file where the record header and data begin, and then transfers the necessary data to or from the program.
trans-unit.target: 定义此文件组织以适应顺序或随机处理。使用 RELATIVE 文件，可以直接读取或写入记录100，而不必先读取或写入记录1-99。GnuCOBOL运行时系统使用程序定义的最大记录大小来计算文件中记录头和数据开始处的相对字节位置，然后将必要的数据传输到程序中或从程序中传输出必要的数据。

trans-unit.source: This file organization was defined to accommodate either sequential or random processing. With aRELATIVEfile, it is possible to read or write record 100 directly, without having to have first read or written records 1-99. The GnuCOBOL runtime system uses the program-defined maximum record size to calculate a relative byte position in the file where the record header and data begin, and then transfers the necessary data to or from the program.
trans-unit.target: 定义此文件组织以适应顺序或随机处理。使用 RELATIVE 文件，可以直接读取或写入记录100，而不必先读取或写入记录1-99。GnuCOBOL运行时系统使用程序定义的最大记录大小来计算文件中记录头和数据开始的相对字节位置，然后将必要的数据传输到程序中或从程序中传输出必要的数据。

trans-unit.source: This first set of picture symbols defines the basic data type of a data item. Each symbol represents a single character’s worth of storage.
trans-unit.target: 第一组图片符号定义数据项的基本数据类型。每个符号代表单个字符的存储价值。

trans-unit.source: This form of the DISPLAY statement can be used to create or modify environment variables.
trans-unit.target: 这种形式的 DISPLAY 语句可用于创建或修改环境变量。

trans-unit.source: This form of the DISPLAY statement may be used to specify the command-line argument number to be retrieved by a subsequent ACCEPT FROM ARGUMENT-VALUE statement (see ACCEPT FROM COMMAND-LINE) or to specify a new value for the command-line arguments themselves.
trans-unit.target: 这种形式的 DISPLAY 语句可用于指定要由后续 ACCEPT FROM ARGUMENT-VALUE 语句检索的命令行参数编号（请参阅ACCEPT FROM COMMAND-LINE）或为命令行参数本身指定新值。

trans-unit.source: This form of the GO TO statement unconditionally transfers control in a program to the first executable statement within the specified procedure-name-1.
trans-unit.target: 这种形式的 GO TO 语句无条件地将程序中的控制权转移到指定的 procedure-name-1 内的第一个可执行语句。

trans-unit.source: This form of the GO TO statement will transfer control to any one of a number of specified procedure names depending on the numeric value of the identifier specified on the statement.
trans-unit.target: 这种形式的 GO TO 语句将控制转移到许多指定过程名称中的任何一个，具体取决于语句上指定的标识符的数值。

trans-unit.source: This form of the READ statement retrieves an arbitrary record from an ORGANIZATION RELATIVE (see ORGANIZATION RELATIVE) or ORGANIZATION INDEXED (see ORGANIZATION INDEXED) file.
trans-unit.target: 这种形式的 READ 语句从 ORGANIZATION RELATIVE （请参阅ORGANIZATION RELATIVE）或 ORGANIZATION INDEXED （请参见ORGANIZATION INDEXED）文件中检索任意记录。

trans-unit.source: This form of the READ statement retrieves the next (or previous) record from a file.
trans-unit.target: 这种形式的 READ 语句从文件中检索下一个（或上一个）记录。

trans-unit.source: This form of the SET statement is used to turn switches on or off.
trans-unit.target: SET 语句的这种形式用于打开或关闭开关。

trans-unit.source: This format of the ACCEPT statement is used to read a value from the console window or the standard input device and store it into a data item (identifier-1).
trans-unit.target: ACCEPT 语句的这种格式用于从控制台窗口或标准输入设备读取值，并将其存储到数据项（ identifier-1 ）中。

trans-unit.source: This format of the ACCEPT statement is used to retrieve data from a formatted console window screen.
trans-unit.target: ACCEPT 语句的这种格式用于从格式化的控制台窗口屏幕检索数据。

trans-unit.source: This format of the ACCEPT statement is used to retrieve environment variable values.
trans-unit.target: ACCEPT 语句的这种格式用于检索环境变量值。

trans-unit.source: This format of the ACCEPT statement is used to retrieve information about the console window or about the user’s interactions with it.
trans-unit.target: ACCEPT 语句的这种格式用于检索有关控制台窗口或用户与其交互的信息。

trans-unit.source: This format of the ACCEPT statement is used to retrieve information from the program’s command line.
trans-unit.target: ACCEPT 语句的这种格式用于从程序的命令行中检索信息。

trans-unit.source: This format of the ACCEPT statement is used to retrieve run-time information such as the most-recent error exception code and the current user’s user name.
trans-unit.target: ACCEPT 语句的这种格式用于检索运行时信息，例如最近的错误异常代码和当前用户的用户名。

trans-unit.source: This format of the ACCEPT statement is used to retrieve the current system date, time or current day of the week and store it into a data item.
trans-unit.target: ACCEPT 语句的这种格式用于检索当前系统日期，时间或星期几，并将其存储到数据项中。

trans-unit.source: This format of the ACCEPT statement will be terminated by any of the following events:
trans-unit.target: ACCEPT 语句的这种格式将由以下任何事件终止：

trans-unit.source: This format of the ACCEPT statement will receive the status for any exceptions resulting from a previous valid verb.
trans-unit.target: ACCEPT 语句的这种格式将接收由先前有效动词引起的任何异常的状态。

trans-unit.source: This format of the ACCEPT statement will wait for a keyboard event that terminates input; function keys, or Enter/Return, among others. CRT STATUS (COB-CRT-STATUS CRT STATUS (see SPECIAL-NAMES) if not explicitly defined) is set with the keycode, listed in copy/screenio.cpy. It also handles a few other keycode terminations not normally used to complete an extended accept.
trans-unit.target: ACCEPT 语句的这种格式将等待键盘事件终止输入。功能键或Enter / Return等。CRT STATUS（如果未明确定义，则为COB-CRT-STATUS CRT STATUS （请参阅SPECIAL-NAMES））使用在copy / screenio.cpy中列出的键码进行设置。它还处理一些其他通常不用于完成扩展接受的键码终止。

trans-unit.source: This format of the ADD statement generates an intermediate arithmetic sum of the values of all identifier-1 and literal-1) items. The value of each identifier-2 will be replaced, in turn, by the sum of that identifier-2s value and the intermediate sum.
trans-unit.target: ADD 语句的这种格式生成所有 identifier-1 和 literal-1 项的值的中间算术和。每个 identifier-2 的值将依次替换为该 identifier-2 的值与中间和的和。

trans-unit.source: This format of the ADD statement generates code equivalent to individual ADD TO (see ADD TO) statements for corresponding matches of data items found subordinate to the two identifiers.
trans-unit.target: ADD 语句的这种格式会生成与单个 ADD TO （请参见ADD TO）语句等效的代码，以查找从属于两个标识符的数据项的相应匹配。

trans-unit.source: This format of the ADD statement generates the arithmetic sum of the values of all identifier-1, literal-1) and identifier-2 (if any) items and then saves that sum to each identifier-3.
trans-unit.target: ADD 语句的这种格式生成所有 identifier-1 ， literal-1 和 identifier-2 （如果有）项的值的算术和，然后将该和保存到每个 identifier-3 。

trans-unit.source: This format of the DISPLAY statement displays the specified identifier contents and/or literal values on the system output device specified via the UPON clause.
trans-unit.target: DISPLAY 语句的这种格式在通过 UPON 子句指定的系统输出设备上显示指定的标识符内容和/或文字值。

trans-unit.source: This format of the DISPLAY statement presents data onto a formatted screen.
trans-unit.target: DISPLAY 语句的这种格式将数据显示在格式化的屏幕上。

trans-unit.source: This format of the DIVIDE statement will divide a numeric value (specified as a literal or numeric data item) into one or more numeric data items, replacing the value in each of those data items with the result(s).
trans-unit.target: DIVIDE 语句的这种格式会将数字值（指定为文字或数字数据项）划分为一个或多个数字数据项，并将每个数据项中的值替换为结果。

trans-unit.source: This format of the DIVIDE statement will divide one numeric value (specified as a literal or numeric data item) into another numeric value (also specified as a literal or numeric data item) and will then replace the contents of one or more receiving data items with the results of that division.
trans-unit.target: DIVIDE 语句的这种格式会将一个数字值（指定为文字或数字数据项）划分为另一个数字值（也指定为文字或数字数据项），然后将一个或多个接收数据项的内容替换为该划分的结果。

trans-unit.source: This format of the PERFORM statement is identical in operation to the procedural PERFORM, except for the fact that the statement(s) comprising the perform scope (imperative-statement-1) (see Imperative Statement) are now specified in-line with the PERFORM code rather than in procedures located elsewhere within the program.
trans-unit.target: PERFORM 语句的这种格式在操作上与过程 PERFORM 相同，不同之处在于，现在已与 PERFORM 一致地指定了包含perform范围（ imperative-statement-1 ）（请参阅Imperative语句）的语句。代码，而不是位于程序其他位置的过程中。

trans-unit.source: This format of the PERFORM statement is used to transfer control to one or more procedures, which will return control back when complete. Execution of the procedure(s) can be done a single time, multiple times, repeatedly until a condition becomes TRUE or forever (with some way of breaking out of the control of the PERFORM or of halting program execution within the procedure(s)).
trans-unit.target: PERFORM 语句的这种格式用于将控制权转移到一个或多个过程，该过程将在完成后将控制权返回。可以单次，多次，重复执行该过程，直到条件变为 TRUE 或永远永久（以某种方式打破 PERFORM 的控制权或中止该过程中的程序执行） 。

trans-unit.source: This format of the SORT statement is designed to sort large volumes of data according to one or more key fields.
trans-unit.target: SORT 语句的这种格式旨在根据一个或多个关键字段对大量数据进行排序。

trans-unit.source: This format of the SORT statement sorts relatively small quantities of data — namely data contained in a data division table — according to one or more key fields.
trans-unit.target: SORT 语句的这种格式根据一个或多个关键字段对相对少量的数据（即数据分区表中包含的数据）进行排序。

trans-unit.source: This format of the SUBTRACT statement generates the arithmetic sum of all arguments that appear before the FROM (identifier-1 or literal-1) and subtracts that sum from each identifier-2.
trans-unit.target: SUBTRACT 语句的这种格式生成出现在 FROM （ identifier-1 或 literal-1 ）之前的所有参数的算术和，并从每个 identifier-2 减去该和。

trans-unit.source: This format of the VALUE clause may not be used anywhere in the description of an 01 item (or any of its subordinate items) serving as an FD or SD record description.
trans-unit.target: VALUE 子句的这种格式在用作 FD 或 SD 记录描述的01项目（或其任何从属项目）的描述中可能不会在任何地方使用。

trans-unit.source: This format of theACCEPTstatement will be terminated by any of the following events:
trans-unit.target: 以下任何事件将终止 ACCEPT 语句的这种格式：

trans-unit.source: This format of theVALUEclause may not be used anywhere in the description of an 01 item (or any of it’s subordinate items) serving as anFDorSDrecord description.
trans-unit.target: VALUE 子句的这种格式在用作 FD 或 SD 记录描述的01项目（或其任何从属项目）的描述中可能不会在任何地方使用。

trans-unit.source: This function Returns the date the GnuCOBOL program that is executing the function was compiled, in the form yyyymmdd.
trans-unit.target: 此函数 返回正在执行函数的 GnuCOBOL 程序的编译日期,格式为 yyyymmdd。

trans-unit.source: This function computes and returns the factorial value of <var>number</var> (a numeric literal or data item).
trans-unit.target: 此函数计算和返回的阶乘值 <var>number</var> （数字文字或数据项）。

trans-unit.source: This function concatenates the string-1, string-2, … (group items, USAGE DISPLAY elementary items and/or alphanumeric literals) together into a single string result.
trans-unit.target: 此函数将 string-1 ， string-2 ，…（组项目， USAGE DISPLAY 基本项目和/或字母数字文字）串联在一起，成为单个字符串结果。

trans-unit.source: This function converts <var>date</var> (a numeric integer data item or literal) — presumed to be a Gregorian calendar form standard date (YYYYMMDD) — to internal date form (the number of days that have transpired since 1600/12/31).
trans-unit.target: 此函数将 <var>date</var> （假定是公历格式的标准日期（YYYYMMDD））转换为内部日期格式（自1600/12/31起已经发生的天数）（日期是一个数字整数数据项或文字）。

trans-unit.source: This function converts <var>date</var> (a numeric integer data item or literal) — presumed to be a Julian calendar form standard date (YYYYDDD) — to internal date form (the number of days that have transpired since 1600/12/31).
trans-unit.target: 此函数将 <var>date</var> （假定为儒略历标准日期（YYYYDDD））转换为内部日期格式（自1600/12/31起已经发生的天数）（日期数字常量为数字整数或文字）。

trans-unit.source: This function converts a string (a group item, USAGE DISPLAY elementary item or alphanumeric literal) representing a currency value to its corresponding numeric value.
trans-unit.target: 此函数将表示货币值的 string （组项目， USAGE DISPLAY 基本项目或字母数字文字）转换为其相应的数值。

trans-unit.source: This function converts a string (a group item, USAGE DISPLAY elementary item or alphanumeric literal) representing a floating-point value to its corresponding numeric value.
trans-unit.target: 此函数将表示浮点值的 string （组项目， USAGE DISPLAY 基本项目或字母数字文字）转换为其相应的数值。

trans-unit.source: This function decodes the string <var>time</var> — whose value represents a formatted time — and returns the total number of seconds that string represents.
trans-unit.target: 此函数解码字符串 <var>time</var> （其值表示格式化的时间），并返回字符串表示的总秒数。

trans-unit.source: This function determines and returns the absolute value of <var>number</var> (a numeric literal or data item) supplied as an argument.
trans-unit.target: 这个函数确定并返回的绝对值 <var>number</var> 作为参数提供（数字文字或数据项）。

trans-unit.source: This function determines and returns the trigonometric sine of <var>angle</var> (a numeric literal or numeric data item).
trans-unit.target: 此函数确定并返回 <var>angle</var> 的三角正弦值（数字文字或数字数据项）。

trans-unit.source: This function determines and returns the trigonometric tangent of <var>angle</var> (a numeric literal or numeric data item).
trans-unit.target: 此函数确定并返回 <var>angle</var> 的三角正切（数字文字或数字数据项）。

trans-unit.source: This function determines if the supplied <var>date</var> (a numeric integer data item or literal) is a valid date.
trans-unit.target: 此函数确定提供的 <var>date</var> （数字整数数据项或文字）是否为有效日期。

trans-unit.source: This function determines if the supplied <var>date</var> argument (a numeric integer data item or literal) is a valid date.
trans-unit.target: 此函数确定提供的 <var>date</var> 参数（数字整数数据项或文字）是否为有效日期。

trans-unit.source: This function evaluates string (a group item, USAGE DISPLAY elementary item or alphanumeric literal) for being appropriate for use as the string argument to a NUMVAL-C (see NUMVAL-C) function, returning to a integer a zero value if it is appropriate otherwise if one or more characters are in error, the position of the first character in error or the length of the field plus one for other cases such as all spaces.
trans-unit.target: 此函数评估适合用作 NUMVAL-C （请参阅NUMVAL-C）函数的 string 参数的 string （组项， USAGE DISPLAY 基本项或字母数字文字），如果合适，则返回整数零值否则，如果一个或多个字符有误，则第一个字符的位置有误或字段的长度加上其他情况下的字符（例如所有空格）。

trans-unit.source: This function evaluates string (a group item, USAGE DISPLAY elementary item or alphanumeric literal) for being appropriate for use as the string argument to a NUMVAL-F (see NUMVAL-F) function, returning to a integer a zero value if it is appropriate otherwise if one or more characters are in error, the position of the first character in error or the length of the field plus one for other cases such as all spaces.
trans-unit.target: 此函数评估适合用作 NUMVAL-F （请参见NUMVAL-F）函数的 string 参数的 string （组项， USAGE DISPLAY 基本项或字母数字文字），如果合适，则返回整数零值否则，如果一个或多个字符有误，则第一个字符的位置有误或字段的长度加上其他情况下的字符（例如所有空格）。

trans-unit.source: This function parses <var>string</var>, replacing all occurrences of <var>from-n</var> strings with the corresponding <var>to-n</var> strings.
trans-unit.target: 此函数解析 <var>string</var> ，将所有出现的 <var>from-n</var> 字符串替换为对应的 <var>to-n</var> 字符串。

trans-unit.source: This function removes LEADING or TRAILING spaces from string (a group item, USAGE DISPLAY elementary item or alphanumeric literal).
trans-unit.target: 此函数从 string （组项目， USAGE DISPLAY 基本项目或字母数字文字）中删除 LEADING 或 TRAILING 空格。

trans-unit.source: This function returns I/O exception information from the most-recently executed input or output statement. The information is returned as a 34-character string, where the first two characters are the two-digit file status value (see File Status Codes) and the remaining 32 are the file-name-1 specification from the file’s SELECT (see SELECT) statement.
trans-unit.target: 该函数从最近执行的输入或输出语句返回I / O异常信息。信息以34个字符的字符串形式返回，其中前两个字符是两位数字的文件状态值（请参阅文件状态代码），其余32个是文件的 SELECT 中的 file-name-1 规范（请参阅SELECT）陈述。

trans-unit.source: This function returns a 12-digit numeric result, the first seven digits of which are the integer value of <var>days</var> argument (a numeric data item or literal) and the last five of which are the integer value of <var>seconds</var> argument (also a numeric data item or literal).
trans-unit.target: 此函数返回12位数字的结果，其中前7位是 <var>days</var> 参数的整数值（数字数据项或文字），而后5位是 <var>seconds</var> 参数的整数值（也是数字数据项）或字面意思）。

trans-unit.source: This function returns a calendar date in yyyyddd (i.e. Julian) format. The date is determined by adding the number of days specified as integer (a numeric integer data item or literal) to December 31, 1600. For example, DAY-OF-INTEGER(1) returns 1601001 while DAY-OF-INTEGER(250000) returns 2011251.
trans-unit.target: 此函数以yyyyddd（即Julian）格式返回日历日期。通过将指定为整数（数字整数数据项或文字）的天数加到1600年12月31日来确定日期。例如， DAY-OF-INTEGER(1) 返回1601001，而 DAY-OF-INTEGER(250000) 返回2011251。

trans-unit.source: This function returns a numeric calendar date in
trans-unit.target: 该函数返回一个数字日历日期,以

trans-unit.source: This function returns a numeric value approximating the ratio of an annuity paid at <var>interest-rate</var> (numeric data item or literal) for each of <var>number-of-periods</var> (numeric data items or literals).
trans-unit.target: 此函数返回一个数值，该数值近似于每个 <var>number-of-periods</var> （数值数据项或立即数）以 <var>interest-rate</var> （数值数据项或立即数）支付的年金的比率。

trans-unit.source: This function returns a numeric value that is the remainder of <var>number</var> divided by <var>divisor</var>. Both arguments must be numeric data items or numeric literals.
trans-unit.target: 该函数返回一个数字值，该值是所述的剩余 <var>number</var> 除以 <var>divisor</var> 。两个参数都必须是数字数据项或数字文字。

trans-unit.source: This function returns a pseudo-random non-integer value in the range 0 to 1 (for example, 0.123456789).
trans-unit.target: 该函数返回一个范围为0到1的伪随机非整数值(例如,0.123456789)。

trans-unit.source: This function returns exception information from the most-recently failing statement. The information is returned to a 1023 character string in one of the following formats, depending on the nature of the failure:
trans-unit.target: 这个函数返回最近一次失败的语句的异常信息。根据失败的性质,信息将以下列格式之一返回一个1023字符的字符串。

trans-unit.source: This function returns that portion of number (a numeric data item or a numeric literal) that occurs to the right of the decimal point. FRACTION-PART(3.1415), for example, returns a value of 0.1415. This function is equivalent to the expression:
trans-unit.target: 此函数返回出现在小数点右边的那部分 number （数字数据项或数字文字）。例如，FRACTION FRACTION-PART(3.1415) 返回值0.1415。此函数等效于表达式：

trans-unit.source: This function returns the byte-by-byte reversed value of string (a group item, USAGE DISPLAY elementary item or alphanumeric literal).
trans-unit.target: 此函数返回 string 的逐字节反转值（一个组项目， USAGE DISPLAY 基本项目或字母数字文字）。

trans-unit.source: This function returns the character in the ordinal position specified by integer (a numeric integer literal or data item with a value of 1 or greater) from the COLLATING SEQUENCE (see OBJECT-COMPUTER) being used by the program.
trans-unit.target: 此函数从程序使用的 COLLATING SEQUENCE （请参见OBJECT-COMPUTER）中返回由 integer （数值整数文字或值为1或更大的数据项）指定的序数位置的字符。

trans-unit.source: This function returns the character used to separate the integer portion of a non-integer numeric item from the fractional part according to the rules currently in effect for the locale under which your program is running.
trans-unit.target: 该函数返回用于将非整数数字项的整数部分与小数部分分开的字符,这些字符是根据程序运行所处的语言环境的当前有效规则确定的。

trans-unit.source: This function returns the character used to separate the thousands digit groupings of monetary currency values according to the rules currently in effect for the locale under which your program is running.
trans-unit.target: 该函数返回用于分隔货币价值的千位数组的字符,该字符是根据您的程序运行所在的地区当前有效的规则。

trans-unit.source: This function returns the character used to separate the thousands digit groupings of numeric values according to the rules currently in effect for the locale under which your program is running.
trans-unit.target: 该函数返回用于分隔千位数数值分组的字符,该字符根据你的程序运行所处的语言环境的当前有效规则。

trans-unit.source: This function returns the current time of day expressed as the total number of elapsed seconds since midnight.
trans-unit.target: 该函数返回当前一天的时间,以午夜后的总经过秒数表示。

trans-unit.source: This function returns the error type (a text string — see column 2 of the upcoming table for the possible values) from the most-recent COBOL statement that generated an exception condition.
trans-unit.target: 此函数从最近的产生异常条件的COBOL语句返回错误类型（文本字符串-参见后面表格的第2列以获取可能的值）。

trans-unit.source: This function returns the full path to the executable version of this GnuCOBOL program. The filename component of this value will be exactly as typed on the command line, down to the use of upper- and lower-case letters and presence (or absence) of any extension.
trans-unit.target: 这个函数返回这个 GnuCOBOL 程序可执行版本的完整路径。这个值的文件名部分将与命令行中输入的完全一致,包括大写和小写字母的使用以及是否有任何扩展名。

trans-unit.source: This function returns the fully-formatted date and time when the program executing the function was compiled. The exact format of this returned string value may vary depending on the operating system and GnuCOBOL build type.
trans-unit.target: 该函数返回执行该函数的程序被编译时的完整格式化的日期和时间。这个返回的字符串值的确切格式可能会根据操作系统和GnuCOBOL构建类型而有所不同。

trans-unit.source: This function returns the highest (i.e. largest or farthest away from 0 in a positive direction if <var>numeric-identifier</var> is signed) value that could possibly be stored in <var>numeric-identifier</var>.
trans-unit.target: 此函数返回可能存储在 <var>numeric-identifier</var> 中的最高值（即，如果对 <var>numeric-identifier</var> 进行了签名，则在正方向上远离0的最大值）。

trans-unit.source: This function returns the length — in bytes of storage — of string (a group item, USAGE DISPLAY elementary item or alphanumeric literal).
trans-unit.target: 此函数返回 string （一个组项目， USAGE DISPLAY 基本项目或字母数字文字）的长度（以存储字节为单位）。

trans-unit.source: This function returns the lowest (i.e. smallest or farthest away from 0 in a negative direction if <var>numeric-identifier</var> is signed) value that could possibly be stored in <var>numeric-identifier</var>.
trans-unit.target: 此函数返回可能存储在 <var>numeric-identifier</var> 中的最低值（即，如果对 <var>numeric-identifier</var> 进行了签名，则在负方向上距离0最小或最远）。

trans-unit.source: This function returns the mathematical constant
trans-unit.target: 该函数返回数学常数

trans-unit.source: This function returns the maximum value from the specified list of numbers (each <var>number-n</var> may be a numeric data item or a numeric literal).
trans-unit.target: 此函数从指定的数字列表中返回最大值（每个 <var>number-n</var> 可以是数字数据项或数字文字）。

trans-unit.source: This function returns the minimum value from the specified list of numbers (each <var>number-n</var> may be a numeric data item or a numeric literal).
trans-unit.target: 此函数从指定的数字列表中返回最小值（每个 <var>number-n</var> 可以是数字数据项或数字文字）。

trans-unit.source: This function returns the most-recent COBOL statement that generated an exception condition.
trans-unit.target: 该函数返回最近一次产生异常条件的COBOL语句。

trans-unit.source: This function returns the null string if it is executed within a main program. When executed with a subprogram, it returns the entry-point name of the program that called the subprogram.
trans-unit.target: 如果在主程序中执行,该函数返回空字符串。当与子程序一起执行时,它返回调用子程序的程序的入口点名称。

trans-unit.source: This function returns the numeric value represented by the character string specified by <var>argument-1</var> and defined as alphanumeric.
trans-unit.target: 此函数返回由 <var>argument-1</var> 指定并定义为字母数字的字符串表示的数值。

trans-unit.source: This function returns the ordinal position in the argument list corresponding to the <var>char-n</var> whose 1<sup>st</sup> character has the highest position in the program collating sequence (usually <small>ASCII</small>).
trans-unit.target: 该函数返回相应于参数列表中的顺序位置 <var>char-n</var> 其1个<sup>ST</sup>字符具有程序排序序列（通常在最高位置<small>ASCII</small>）。

trans-unit.source: This function returns the ordinal position in the argument list corresponding to the <var>char-n</var> whose 1<sup>st</sup> character has the lowest position in the program collating sequence (usually <small>ASCII</small>).
trans-unit.target: 该函数返回相应于参数列表中的顺序位置 <var>char-n</var> 其1个<sup>ST</sup>字符具有程序排序序列（通常在最低位置<small>ASCII</small>）。

trans-unit.source: This function returns the ordinal position in the program character set (usually ASCII) corresponding to the 1st character of char argument (a group item, USAGE DISPLAY elementary item or alphanumeric literal).

trans-unit.source: This is an executable file directly-executable from the command-line. On Windows computers, this would be an ".exe" file. On Unix systems, this will be a file with no specific extension, but with execute permissions. This file will include the main program as well as any static-linked subprograms.

trans-unit.source: This is another obsolete area of COBOL statements. This part of every statement also hails back to the day when programs were punched on cards; it was expected that the name of the program (or at least the first 8 characters of it) would be punched here so that — if a dropped COBOL source deck contained more than one program — that handy card sorter machine could be used to first separate the cards by program name and then sort them by sequence number. Today’s COBOL compilers (including GnuCOBOL) simply ignore anything past column 72.
trans-unit.target: 这是COBOL语句的另一个过时区域。每个语句的这一部分还可以追溯到在卡片上打孔程序的那一天。可以预期在此处打上程序的名称（或至少程序的前8个字符），以便-如果放下的COBOL源代码甲板包含多个程序，则可以使用该便携式卡分类器首先进行分离按程序名称对卡片进行排序，然后按序列号对卡片进行排序。当今的COBOL编译器（包括GnuCOBOL）仅忽略第72列之后的所有内容。

trans-unit.source: This option allows one or more data items within one group item (<var>group-item-1</var> — the first named on the statement) to be paired with correspondingly-named (hence the name) in a second group item (<var>group-item-2</var> — the second named on the statement). The contents of <var>group-item-1</var> will remain unaffected by the statement while one or more data items within <var>group-item-2</var> will be changed.

trans-unit.source: This routine returns the name of the program that called the currently-executing program. The program name will be returned, left-justified and space filled, in prog-name-area argument, which should be a PIC X elementary item or a group item. If prog-name-area is too small to receive the entire program name, the program name value will be truncated (on the right) to fit.
trans-unit.target: 该例程返回调用当前执行程序的程序的名称。程序名称将在 prog-name-area 参数中返回，左对齐并以空格填充，该参数应该是 PIC X 基本项目或组项目。如果 prog-name-area 太小而无法接收整个程序名称，则程序名称值将被截断（在右侧）以适合。

trans-unit.source: This routine unpacks each bit of the single-byte data item <var>byte</var> into the low-order (rightmost) bit of each of the corresponding eight 1-byte items in <var>table</var>. The other seven bit positions of each of the first eight entries in <var>table</var> will be set to zero.
trans-unit.target: 此例程将单字节数据项 <var>byte</var> 每一位解压缩为 <var>table</var> 相应的八个1字节项中每个项的低位（最右边）。在每一个前八个条目的其他七个位的位置 <var>table</var> 将被设置为零。

trans-unit.source: This section contains an example of the RWCS at work. The complete program, presented here, is a stripped-down version of a program I have used to generate a report for a class I teach on PC hardware. This report will provide benchmark statistics on a variety of popular AMD and Intel CPUs. The data for the report was obtained from the website www.cpubenchmark.net in December of 2013. By the time you are reading this, that data will most likely have become rather out of date, but it illustrates RWCS well enough.
trans-unit.target: 本节包含工作中的RWCS的示例。此处提供的完整程序是我用来为我在PC硬件上教授的课程的报告时所使用的程序的简化版本。该报告将提供各种流行的AMD和Intel CPU的基准统计数据。该报告的数据是从2013年12月从网站www.cpubenchmark.net获得的。在您阅读本文时，该数据很可能已经过时了，但是它充分说明了RWCS。

trans-unit.source: This section contains an example of the RWCS at work. The complete program, presented here, is a stripped-down version of a program I have used to generate a report for a class I teach on PC hardware. This report will provide benchmark statistics on a variety of popular AMD and Intel CPUs. The data for the report was obtained from the website www.cpubenchmark.net in December of 2013. By the time you are reading this, that data will most likely have become rather out-of-date, but it illustrates RWCS well enough.
trans-unit.target: 本节包含工作中的RWCS的示例。此处提供的完整程序是我用来为我在PC硬件上教授的课程的报告时所使用的程序的简化版本。该报告将提供各种流行的AMD和Intel CPU的基准统计数据。该报告的数据是从2013年12月从网站www.cpubenchmark.net获得的。在您阅读本文时，该数据很可能已经过时了，但它足以说明RWCS。

trans-unit.target: 本节定义了程序编译和执行的计算机系统,并指定了任何特殊的环境配置或兼容性特征。

trans-unit.source: This section describes the layout of printed reports as well as many of the functional aspects of the generation of reports that will be produced via the Report Writer Control System. It is important to maintain the order of these clauses and ensure that all fields defined or referenced with this section are actually defined in the WORKING-STORAGE SECTION and not elsewhere.

trans-unit.source: This statement (perhaps in combination with an appropriate comment or two) makes a convenient "place holder" — particularly inELSE(see IF) orWHEN(see EVALUATE) clauses where no code is currently expected to be needed, but a place for code to handle the conditions in question is to be reserved in case it’s ever needed.
trans-unit.target: 该语句（可能与适当的注释或两个注释结合使用）成为方便的“占位符”，尤其是在 ELSE （请参阅IF）或 WHEN （请参阅EVALUATE）子句中，目前预计不需要代码，但需要放置代码处理有问题的条件将保留，以备不时之需。

trans-unit.source: This statement exists within GnuCOBOL to provide compatibility with COBOL programs written to pre-1985 standards. The TRANSFORM statement was made obsolete in the 1985 standard of COBOL, having been replaced by the CONVERTING clause of the INSPECT statement (see INSPECT). New programs should be coded to use INSPECT CONVERTING rather than TRANSFORM.
trans-unit.target: 该声明存在于GnuCOBOL中，以提供与按1985年前的标准编写的COBOL程序的兼容性。的 TRANSFORM 语句是在1985年标准COBOL的过时，由已经替换 CONVERTING 所述的子句 INSPECT 声明（见INSPECT）。新程序应编码为使用 INSPECT CONVERTING 而不是 TRANSFORM 。

trans-unit.source: This subroutine performs a bit-by-bit comparison between the left-most 8*<var>byte-length</var> corresponding bits of <var>item-1</var> and <var>item-2</var>, storing the resulting bit string into <var>item-2</var>. The truth table shown to the left documents the EQ process. The <var>item-1</var> argument may be an alphanumeric literal or a data item and <var>item-2</var> must be a data item. The length of both <var>item-1</var> and <var>item-2</var> must be at least 8*<var>byte-length</var>.
trans-unit.target: 此子例程在 <var>item-1</var> 和 <var>item-2</var> 的最左8 * <var>byte-length</var> 对应位之间执行逐位比较，并将结果位字符串存储到 <var>item-2</var> 中。左侧显示的真值表记录了EQ过程。该 <var>item-1</var> 参数可以是字母数字或文字的数据项和 <var>item-2</var> 必须是一个数据项。 <var>item-1</var> 和 <var>item-2</var> 的长度都必须至少为8 * <var>byte-length</var> 。

trans-unit.source: This subroutine puts the program to sleep for the specified number of nanoseconds.
trans-unit.target: 该子程序使程序在指定的纳秒数内进入睡眠状态。

trans-unit.source: This subroutine returns the number of arguments passed to the program that calls it back to in the numeric field <var>arg-count-result</var>. When called from within a user-defined function, a value of one (1) is returned if any arguments were passed to the function or a zero (0) otherwise.
trans-unit.target: 该子例程在数字字段 <var>arg-count-result</var> 中返回传递给调用它的程序的参数数量。从用户定义的函数中调用时，如果将任何参数传递给该函数，则返回一（1）的值，否则返回零（0）的值。

trans-unit.source: This subroutine returns the size (in bytes) of the subroutine argument supplied using the <var>argument-number</var> parameter (a numeric literal or data item).
trans-unit.target: 该子例程返回使用 <var>argument-number</var> 参数（数字文字或数据项）提供的子例程参数的大小（以字节为单位）。

trans-unit.source: This subroutine submits <var>command</var> (an alphanumeric literal or data item) to a command shell for execution as if it were typed into a console/terminal window.
trans-unit.target: 该子例程将 <var>command</var> （字母数字文字或数据项）提交到命令外壳以供执行，就像在控制台/终端窗口中键入命令一样。

trans-unit.source: This subroutine will retrieve the current cursor location on the screen, returning a 2-byte value into the supplied <var>cursor-locn-buffer</var>. The first byte of <var>cursor-locn-buffer</var> will receive the current line (row) location while the second receives the current column location.
trans-unit.target: 该子例程将检索屏幕上的当前光标位置，并将2字节的值返回到提供的 <var>cursor-locn-buffer</var> 中。 <var>cursor-locn-buffer</var> 的第一个字节将接收当前行（行）位置，而第二个字节将接收当前列位置。

trans-unit.source: This symbol is coded as the two characters "C" and "R". If the value of the numeric value moved into the field is positive (0 or greater), two spaces will be inserted. If the value is negative (less than 0), the characters "CR" (credit) are inserted.
trans-unit.target: 这个符号被编码为两个字符 "C "和 "R"。如果移入字段的数值为正值(0或更大),将插入两个空格。如果数值为负值(小于0),则插入 "CR"(信用)字符。

trans-unit.source: This symbol is coded as the two characters "D" and "B". If the value of the numeric value moved into the field is positive (0 or greater), two spaces will be inserted. If the value is negative (less than 0), the characters "DB" (debit) are inserted.
trans-unit.target: 该符号的编码为 "D "和 "B "两个字符。如果移入字段的数值为正值(0或更大),将插入两个空格。如果数值为负值(小于0),则插入 "DB"(借方)字符。

trans-unit.source: This symbol is used to define where an implied decimal-point (if any) is located in a numeric item. Just as there may only be a single decimal point in a number so may there be no more than oneVin aPICTURE Implied decimal points occupy no space in storage — they just specify how values are used. For example, if the value1234is in storage in a field defined as PIC 999V9, that value would be treated as 123.4 in any statements that referenced it.
trans-unit.target: 该符号用于定义隐式小数点（如果有）在数字项中的位置。正如有可能只是一些单个小数点，可能会有不超过一个 V 在 PICTURE 隐含小数点占用的存储空间没有-他们只是指定的值是如何使用的。例如，如果值 1234 存储在定义为PIC 999V9的字段中，则在引用该值的任何语句中该值将被视为123.4。

trans-unit.source: This symbol, if used, must be the very first symbol in the PICTURE value. A ‘

trans-unit.source: This symbol, if used, must be the very first symbol in thePICTUREvalue. ASindicates that the data item isSigned meaning that negative values are possible for this data item. Without anS any negative values stored into this data item via aMOVEor arithmetic statement will have the negative sign stripped from it (in effect becoming the absolute value).
trans-unit.target: 如果使用此符号，则它必须是 PICTURE 值中的第一个符号。甲 S 表示该数据项被 Signed 的意思是负值也是可能的该数据项。如果没有 S ,则任何通过 MOVE 或算术语句存储到此数据项中的负值都将去除负号（实际上成为绝对值）。

trans-unit.target: 这也是一个视频功能,是依托于

trans-unit.source: This too is a video feature that is dependent upon the "curses" package built into your version of GnuCOBOL. If blinking is enabled in that package, text displayed in fields defined in the screen section as being blinking will endlessly cycle between the brightest possible setting (highlight) and an "invisible" setting where the text color matches that of the field background color. A Windows build, which generally uses the "pcurses" package, will uses a brighter-than-normal background color to signify "blinking".
trans-unit.target: 这也是一个视频功能,它依赖于你的GnuCOBOL版本中内置的 "curses "包。如果在该包中启用了闪烁功能,那么在屏幕部分定义为闪烁的字段中显示的文本将在最亮的设置(高亮)和 "不可见 "设置(文本颜色与字段背景颜色一致)之间无休止地循环。一般使用 "pcurses "包的Windows构建,将使用比正常背景色更亮的颜色来表示 "闪烁"。

trans-unit.source: Through the CALL statement, COBOL programs may invoke other COBOL programs serving as subprograms. This is quite similar to cross-program linkage capabilities provided by other languages. In GnuCOBOL’s case, the CALL facility is powerful enough to be tailored to the point where a GnuCOBOL program can communicate with operating system, database management and run-time library APIs, even if they weren’t written in COBOL themselves. See GnuCOBOL Main Programs CALLing C Subprograms, for an example of how a GnuCOBOL program could invoke a C-language subprogram, passing information back and forth between the two.
trans-unit.target: 通过 CALL 语句，COBOL程序可以调用用作子程序的其他COBOL程序。这与其他语言提供的跨程序链接功能非常相似。在GnuCOBOL的情况下， CALL 工具足够强大，可以定制为GnuCOBOL程序可以与操作系统，数据库管理和运行时库API进行通信的点，即使它们不是用COBOL本身编写的。有关GnuCOBOL程序如何调用C语言子程序，在两个子程序之间来回传递信息的示例，请参见GnuCOBOL主程序调用C子程序。

trans-unit.source: Through theCALLstatement, COBOL programs may invoke other COBOL programs serving as subprograms. This is quite similar to cross-program linkage capabilities provided by other languages. In GnuCOBOL’s case, theCALLfacility is powerful enough to be tailored to the point where a GnuCOBOL program can communicate with operating system, database management and run-time library APIs, even if they weren’t written in COBOL themselves. See GnuCOBOL Main Programs CALLing C Subprograms, for an example of how a GnuCOBOL program could invoke a C-language subprogram, passing information back and forth between the two.
trans-unit.target: 通过 CALL 语句，COBOL程序可以调用用作子程序的其他COBOL程序。这与其他语言提供的跨程序链接功能非常相似。在GnuCOBOL的情况下， CALL 功能足够强大，可以定制为GnuCOBOL程序可以与操作系统，数据库管理和运行时库API进行通信的点，即使它们本身不是用COBOL编写的。有关GnuCOBOL程序如何调用C语言子程序，在两个子程序之间来回传递信息的示例，请参见GnuCOBOL主程序调用C子程序。

trans-unit.source: Throughout the history of computer programming, the search for new ways to improve of the productivity of programmers has been a major consideration. Other than hobbyists, programming is an activity performed for money, and businesses abhor spending anything more than is absolutely necessary; even government agencies try to spend as little money on projects as is absolutely necessary.
trans-unit.target: 纵观计算机编程的历史,寻找新的方法来提高程序员的生产力是一个重要的考虑因素。除了业余爱好者外,编程是为了金钱而进行的活动,企业厌恶超出绝对必要的开支;即使是政府机构,也尽量在项目上少花钱,因为这是绝对必要的。

trans-unit.source: To avoid any possible ambiguity, as well as to improve program readability, it’s considered good COBOL programming practice to always code at least one space to both the left and right of every operator in arithmetic expressions as well as the = sign on a COMPUTE.
trans-unit.target: 为了避免任何歧义，并提高程序的可读性，在COBOL编程实践中，始终在算术表达式中的每个运算符的左侧和右侧都至少编码一个空格，以及在COMPUTE上使用 = 符号，这被认为是一种良好的COBOL编程实践。

trans-unit.source: Today’s IT managers and business leaders are faced with a challenging dilemma — how do you maintain the enormous COBOL code base that is still running their businesses when academia has all but abandoned the language they need their people to use to keep the wheels rolling? The problem is compounded by the fact that those programmers that are skilled in COBOL are retiring and taking their knowledge with them. In some markets, this appears to be having an inflationary effect on the cost of resources (COBOL programmers) whose supply is becoming smaller and smaller. The pressure to update applications to make use of more up-to-date graphical user interfaces is also perceived as a reason to abandon COBOL in favour of GUI-friendly languages such as Java.
trans-unit.target: 当今的IT经理和业务领导者面临着一个充满挑战的难题–当学术界几乎放弃了他们需要的人员使用的语言以保持运转时，如何维护仍在运行其业务的庞大COBOL代码库？问题在于，那些精通COBOL的程序员正在退休并与他们一起获取知识，这一事实使问题更加复杂。在某些市场中，这似乎对资源成本（COBOL程序员）的通货膨胀产生了影响，这些资源的供给越来越小。人们也认为，更新应用程序以使用最新的图形用户界面的压力是放弃COBOL而是转而使用GUI友好的语言（例如Java）的原因。

trans-unit.source: Today’s current programming languages have a statement (usually, this statement is named "import", "include" or "#include") that performs this same function. What makes the COBOL copybook feature different than the "include" facility in newer languages, however, is the fact that theCOPYstatement can edit the imported source code as it is being copied. This capability makes copybook libraries extremely valuable to making code reusable.
trans-unit.target: 当今的当前编程语言具有执行相同功能的语句（通常，该语句名为“ import”，“ include”或“ #include”）。但是，使COBOL抄写本功能与更新语言中的“ include”功能有所不同的原因是， COPY 语句可以在复制导入的源代码时对其进行编辑。此功能使抄写本库对于使代码可重用非常有价值。

trans-unit.source: Today’s current programming languages have a statement (usually, this statement is named “import”, “include” or “#include”) that performs this same function. What makes the COBOL copybook feature different than the “include” facility in newer languages, however, is the fact that the COPY statement can edit the imported source code as it is being copied. This capability makes copybook libraries extremely valuable to making code reusable. Also see section 3. Compiler Directing Facility commands COPY and REPLACE.
trans-unit.target: 当今的当前编程语言具有执行相同功能的语句（通常将此语句命名为“ import”，“ include”或“ #include”）。但是，使COBOL抄写本功能与更新语言中的“ include”功能不同的原因在于， COPY 语句可以在复制导入的源代码时对其进行编辑。此功能使抄写本库对于使代码可重用非常有价值。另请参阅第3节。编译器定向工具命令COPY和REPLACE。

trans-unit.source: Training their own COBOL programmers. Since colleges, universities and technical schools have lost interest in doing so, many businesses have undertaken the task of "growing their own" new crop of COBOL programmers. Fear of being pigeon-holed into a niche technology is a factor inhibiting many of today’s programmers from willingly volunteering for such training.
trans-unit.target: 培训自己的COBOL程序员。由于学院，大学和技术学校对此失去了兴趣，因此许多企业承担了“种植自己的”新型COBOL程序员的任务。害怕被鸽子打入利基技术，这是阻碍当今许多程序员自愿自愿参加此类培训的一个因素。

trans-unit.source: Two CDF variables, two literals or a single CDF variable and a single literal may be compared against each other using a relational operator. Unlike the standard GnuCOBOL IF statement (see IF), multiple comparisons cannot be ANDed or ORed together; you may nest a second >>IF inside the first, however, to simulate an AND and an OR may be simulated via the >>ELIF option.
trans-unit.target: 可以使用关系运算符将两个CDF变量，两个文字或一个CDF变量和一个文字进行比较。与标准的GnuCOBOL IF 语句（请参阅IF）不同，不能将多个比较进行 AND 或 OR 运算；您可以在第一个 >>IF 中嵌套第二个>> IF，但是，为了模拟 AND ，可以通过 >>ELIF 选项模拟 OR 。

trans-unit.source: Two CDF variables, two literals or a single CDF variable and a single literal may be compared against each other using a relational operator. Unlike the standard GnuCOBOLIFstatement (see IF), multiple comparisons cannot be "AND"ed or "OR"ed together; you may nest a second>>IFinside the first, however, to simulate an "AND" and an "OR" may be simulated via the>>ELIFoption.
trans-unit.target: 可以使用关系运算符将两个CDF变量，两个文字或一个CDF变量和一个文字进行比较。与标准的GnuCOBOL IF 语句（请参阅IF）不同，不能将多个比较“与”或“或”在一起；您可以在第一个 >>IF 中嵌套第二个>> IF，但是，可以通过 >>ELIF 选项来模拟“ AND”和“ OR” 。

trans-unit.source: Unlike the TALLYING and REPLACING clauses, both of which may have multiple operations specified, there may be only one CONVERTING operation per INSPECT.
trans-unit.target: 不同于 TALLYING 和 REPLACING 条款，这两者都可能具有多个操作中指定，有可能只有一个 CONVERTING 每个操作 INSPECT 。

trans-unit.source: Unlike the WHEN-COMPILED special register, which has an ASCII value of the compilation date/time in the format mm/dd/yyhh.mm.ss, the WHEN-COMPILED intrinsic function returns the compilation date/time as an ASCII string in the format yyyymmddhhmmssnnooooo, where yyyymmdd is the date, hhmmss is the time, nn is the hundredths of a second component of the compilation time, if available (or 00 if it isn’t) and ooooo is the time zone offset from GMT.
trans-unit.target: 与 WHEN-COMPILED 特殊寄存器不同，后者的编译日期/时间的ASCII值格式为 mm/dd/yyhh.mm.ss ，而 WHEN-COMPILED 固有函数将编译日期/时间作为ASCII字符串返回。格式为 yyyymmddhhmmssnnooooo ，其中 yyyymmdd 是日期， hhmmss 是时间， nn 是编译时间的第二个分量的百分之一，如果可以的话（如果不是，则为 00 ），而 ooooo 是相对于GMT的时区偏移量。

trans-unit.source: Unlike theTALLYINGandREPLACINGclauses, both of which may have multiple operations specified, there may be only oneCONVERTINGoperation perINSPECT
trans-unit.target: 不同于 TALLYING 和 REPLACING 条款，这两者都可能具有多个操作中指定，有可能只有一个 CONVERTING 每个操作 INSPECT

trans-unit.source: Unlike theWHEN-COMPILEDspecial register, which has an ASCII value of the compilation date/time in the format "mm/dd/yyhh.mm.ss", theWHEN-COMPILEDintrinsic function returns the compilation date/time as an ASCII string in the format "yyyymmddhhmmssnnooooo", where "yyyymmdd" is the date, "hhmmss" is the time, "nn" is the hundredths of a second component of the compilation time, if available (or "00" if it isn’t) and "ooooo" is the time zone offset from GMT.
trans-unit.target: 与 WHEN-COMPILED 特殊寄存器不同，后者的编译日期/时间的ASCII值格式为“ mm / dd / yyhh.mm.ss”， WHEN-COMPILED 固有函数将编译日期/时间作为ASCII字符串返回。格式为“ yyyymmddhhmmssnnooooo”，其中“ yyyymmdd”为日期，“ hhmmss”为时间，“ nn”为编译时间的第二个分量的百分之一（如果有）（如果没有，则为“ 00”）而“ ooooo”是相对格林尼治标准时间的时区偏移量。

trans-unit.source: Unsigned Packed Decimal
trans-unit.target: 无符号填充小数

trans-unit.source: Up Arrow was pressed
trans-unit.target: 上箭头键被按下

trans-unit.source: Upon completion, the RETURN-CODE special register (see Special Registers) will be set to 0 if the read was successful or to 10 if an "end-of-file" condition occurred. If a value of -1 is returned, a problem was identified with the subroutine arguments.
trans-unit.target: 完成后，如果读取成功，则 RETURN-CODE 特殊寄存器（请参见特殊寄存器）将设置为0，如果发生“文件结束”条件，则将其设置为10。如果返回值-1，则确定子例程参数有问题。

trans-unit.source: Upon completion, the RETURN-CODE special register (see Special Registers) will be set to 0 if the write was successful or to 30 if an I/O error condition occurred. If a value of -1 is returned, a problem was identified with the subroutine arguments.
trans-unit.target: 完成后，如果写入成功，则 RETURN-CODE 特殊寄存器（请参见特殊寄存器）将设置为0，如果发生I / O错误条件，则将其设置为30。如果返回值-1，则确定子例程参数有问题。

trans-unit.source: Upon completion, theRETURN-CODEspecial register (see Special Registers) will be set to 0 if the read was successful or to 10 if an "end-of-file" condition occurred. If a value of -1 is returned, a problem was identified with the subroutine arguments.
trans-unit.target: 完成后，如果成功读取，则 RETURN-CODE 特殊寄存器（请参见特殊寄存器）将设置为0，如果发生“文件结束”条件，则将其设置为10。如果返回值-1，则确定子例程参数有问题。

trans-unit.source: Upon completion, theRETURN-CODEspecial register (see Special Registers) will be set to 0 if the write was successful or to 30 if an I/O error condition occurred. If a value of -1 is returned, a problem was identified with the subroutine arguments.
trans-unit.target: 完成后，如果写入成功，则 RETURN-CODE 特殊寄存器（请参见特殊寄存器）将设置为0，如果发生I / O错误条件，则将其设置为30。如果返回值-1，则确定子例程参数有问题。

trans-unit.source: Usage of the SUPPRESS WHEN clause is used when Sparse Keys are required which may take the form for a literal or spaces or zeroes.
trans-unit.target: 所述的使用 SUPPRESS WHEN 当子句用于 Sparse Keys 都需要可以采取的形式为文字或空格或零。
